results.title: Going places
results.creator_credit: Charles Mapleston, Peter Bradford and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: Designed to set people talking about the whole problem of transportation. Eight independent experts in the field of transport discuss problems arising from the ever-increasing number of vehicles using Britain’s heavily congested roads. Points out how mobility is associated with danger, damage, noise, pollution and ugliness and the need to create a transport system which will improve both communications and the environment.

results.title: Going Our Way
results.creator_credit: Chris Gallagher, Crawford Productions and Victorian Railways
results.brief_description: Presents the many employment opportunities in the Victorian Railways. A young boy playing with his toys, including a train, dreams of his future. He becomes a station assistant. Shows how he learns his job and benefits from the V.R.I. library and sporting clubs. Includes executive officers who started at the bottom and worked their way to the top.

results.title: Goggles!
results.creator_credit: Isa Wickenhagen, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Peter finds a pair of motorcycle goggles without lenses. He and Archie set off with their treasure but run into some big boys who demand the goggles. Suspense mounts as Peter and Archie, with the help of Peter’s loyal daschund, Willie, attempt to outwit the bullies. Based on the book by Ezra Jack Keats.

results.title: Goering
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Twentieth century”.
Goering’s life story. The air race of 1918; exile in Sweden; return to Germany and the early days of Nazism; Goering sets up the storm troops, the Gestapo, the Luftwaffe, is largely responsible for the economic revival of Germany and wins immense popular prestige. Early Luftwaffe triumphs are eclipsed by the failure of operation Sea Lion and the RAAF raids on Germany. Goering falls from power and public prestige to a figurehead. His capture, trial and sentence at Nuremberg.

results.title: Godavari
results.creator_credit: R.S. Junnerker, Jehangir Bhownagary and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: A description of the River Godavari which flows from the hills east of Bombay across northern India to the Bay of Bengal. Includes an account of various temples, shrines, towns and villages built at its source and along its banks.

results.title: The Ancestry of science: the god within
results.brief_description: The influence that contributed to early Greek philosophy and the beginnings of science. Shows the early philosophers seeking to rationalise the world around them; three explanations of the creation of the universe; the foreshadowing of modern quantitative chemistry.

results.title: God bless mummy and make her good
results.creator_credit: Sarah Erulkar, George Howe, ICEM and National Association for Maternal and Child Welfare
results.brief_description: The homes of ordinary families are visited in order to record the natural reactions of the parents and their children in their own environment, doing the things they do every day. Intended to provoke parents into thinking about their relationships with their children.

results.title: Goats
results.brief_description: This film shows life on an American goat farm; care of goats; milking, growth of two kids from birth to two months; use of goats for haulage.

results.title: Goals for the future
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Parents and Children”.
One of a series of films contrasting child care in China, Israel, Russia and Sweden with Britain. Considers such topics as family breakdown, violence and vandalism, and alienation in youth.
